Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek pottery black-figure closed vessel, possibly an amphora; glaze fired orange; exterior, white slipped: glazed band above frieze in black-figure, dappled deer grazing to right (back and belly with dots in added red, shoulders, neck, and forelegs remaining); dot rosette and blobs as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink NAU 11' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80 NAU11) the geochemical characteristics of the fabric points to an origin in the region of Teos.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-9, fig. 4, 80.) (NAU 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GI.005)
